I always pass by this area and finally decided to try with my friend. We tried several dishes and all of them were unique and delicious. I definitely will go back soon for other dishes and drinks!   Ambiance It is a beautiful place with lots of reclaimed wood and unique lightings. I felt like I was walking into a gallery almost. It has communal table section with beautiful lightings and air-plant art on the wall, sushi bar area, table seating area and Tatami rooms. Their Tatami rooms are beautiful and private. It has doors between rooms and separate entrance. The calm atmosphere balances very well with dynamic calligraphy artwork on the wall.  Food *Hamachi Carpaccio: 3 pieces served, Hamachi was very fresh and flavorful, green onion adds crunchy texture which made it very refreshing in my mouth. *Nagasaki Ramen: Great for the chilly SF weather! White spicy broth was very flavorful and had plenty of seafood and vegetables. This can be my perfect hangover remedy! *Uni Onsen Tamago: Very unique and delicate. Good balance between richness of egg & uni and the refreshing sauce and slices of onions. I used a spoon to eat but you can actually drink to taste all the delicate flavors in your mouth. *Kuruma Ebi Zuke: This was so amazing! The more I chew, the more flavor I could taste. The server informed us that they marinate for two weeks for the perfect flavor and texture.  *Maguro Tataki: It was delightful, if you want something light, this is a good dish to start with. *Gindara Misozuke: Oh Yum... it literally melted in my mouth. The texture of black cod was so soft perfectly flavored with miso. If you like black cod, this is a must try dish.  Dengaku Miso: I love eggplant so I had to try this. The miso sauce on top of the eggplant was so good and it complimented very well with eggplant. *Kalbi Tempura: OH My.... I never could imagine to fry Kalbi. I am a big fan of Kalbi (the Korean rib) and I didn't know what to expect when I ordered this. It was fantastic. period. The meat inside was so tender and flavorful, and the outside was so crispy. Eating it with vegetables and the sauce really made my mouth heavenly.   Desert *Tempura Green Tea Ice Cream: I liked the fact that it was not too sweet. It had beautiful small edible flowers on the plate that certainly added beauty of desert. *Cheesecake with Bi-Rite Ice Cream (Salted Caramel Flavor): I usually wait in line at Bi-Rite Creamery to get Salted Caramel ice cream. So I was so happy to get this desert without waiting so long outside!   Drinks *Akira Organic: I like sake in general and I wanted to try something new that I haven't tried. Server recommended Akira and said this is USDA certified organic sake! It was very smooth and clean yet flavorful.   Overall I LOVED my experience at Izakaya Kou. This place surprised me twice. The first surprise I had was the price. I was expecting higher price because of the beautiful interior and the 3 dollar sign on Yelp, but the price was much lower than I expected which of course made me happy! The second surprise was the quality of the food. Based on the price and the vast amount of menu items, I did not expect too much on food, but the quality of each food I tried were so delicious, and the simple but beautiful plating made a statement.

riw5myXtCJy95mqw08qFZQ.review_text: First impression - place is hella cute w their ambient lighting and bamboo decor. Dope! Date is impressed.. DOUBLE DOPE. Uni Onsen Tamago (A-) - Bomb.com! Tangy, not too heavy and very flavorful with fresh uni. We shared one but could have easily gotten our own. Kurobuta (A) - I can still taste this... The pork was grilled to perfection and so very juicy.. DROOL. Bacon Enoki (B+) - Purdddy good. Mushroomy and exceeded expectations. Hard to get a good clean bite so ended up eating in one mouthful.. Shiro Maguro (B+) - Super soft texture like nommin on a baby's bum ;) Hamachi Kama (B) - Crispy and juicy but boo for bones! :( Unagi Nigiri (C+) - Meh. Karaage w/ Spicy Mayo (B+) - Pretty yummy. $auce was bo$$! Frozen Persimmon (C+) - Aight.. Unique, but too cinnamony, hard to eat, and would probably be better not frozen. I liked the pretty flowers tho. Rice (A) - Nothing makes me happier than some good ass rice.. Overall, great experience, modern interior/classy atmosphere, cool date place, not too expensive compared to peers of similar quality, awesome service and delicious food.  They def go the extra mile when it comes to food presentation and making things look enticing. 4/5 - WOULD NOM AGAIN :D

9akppeqi5dnaIqPyJ75aCw.review_text: after moving to the bay area, i've started to rely more and more on friends to tell me where to go. there are just so many good eats in SF!!!  izakaya kou has a classy, quiet, and minimal feel to it. it has dashes of bold red here and there to provide visual stimulation.  the kabocha croquette, tofu tempataion, and the hamachi carpaccio were delicately plated. we thought the kabocha was the most interesting but also very rich - basically fried and then you have a very carby squash inside. hamachi was very fresh.   great for catching up and ... an alternative to waiting at state bird. :)

nsCV4WEa4wTh5ZP8nYdnCg.review_text: Their specialties and sushi rolls is okay...nothing special and services is average ( the waitress took our order but forgot to out it in, then later forgot to bring it out and the restaurant wasn't packed) I gave 3 stars because of the Nagasaki ramen and kuo sashimi...those two are the best.

WQexpqUhxTm93V3p0Xj6rQ.review_text: At the prices charged, it would be difficult to find a slightly upscale izakaya that provides better food, service and atmosphere than this place. Try the kabocha korokke (croquette), the uni onsen tamago, or any of the sashimi. Some of the best yamakake we've ever had. All the dishes are beautifully presented. A great place to go for sharing small dishes with friends.

rP1JhMcc7sZTzW3KzLpL9w.review_text: One of my best Izakaya experiences in SF so far! Our party of 6 was seated in one of their tatami rooms, so it was very private. *note on that: wear pretty socks, or maybe just shoes that won't take 5 mins to take off* All the partitions were open until other parties started to show up, but even then, noise level stayed pretty consistent.  Highlights: - EXTENDED menu, and they keep adding new items to it!  - ATTENTIVE service - REASONABLE prices - GREAT organic modern decor, good quality tables and partitions - CLEAN, ROOMY bathrooms  We ordered mainly izakaya items from their small dishes, fried, yakitori, and grilled menus, and nothing disappointed. We loved their kabocha croquette  so much that we ordered two more, absolutely delicious. Pork bellies, chickens, bacons, sausages, raw or pickled goodies, we had it all! None of the meats were overcooked, food always arrived piping hot, and the sauces all had different flavours. Presentation was also kind to the eye. Despite the "private" table, I could tell that the restaurant started to fill up, yet our service stayed excellent the whole time. Various members of the wait staff checked in on us, kept our glasses filled, and were surprisingly quick at clearing our table of any empty plates... mmmmm keep the food coming!!!  I was a bit skeptical on trying a new place with a group, but I was really impressed by our experience. Despite it being just a soft opening, everyone already worked like a well-oiled machine.. kudos to that! Definitely looking forward to coming back to try out their other dishes!

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: the space is cool (very woodsy and airy) and I love the semi private room for groups with the traditional tatami look, however, I go to eat, not to sit in a pretty room.  that said, everything is ok to good but nothing is amazing and its definitely not cheap for not amazing and not very Japanese izakaya.

d2MJfhB60QAC-pfYogLZrw.review_text: Awesome place. I love that the waiters speak Japanese (my date also happened to speak japanese, so that was fun). But very authentic atmosphere and food. Nothing we ordered was bad. Presentation was amazing. This has become one of my favorite japanese restaurants for a more romantic evening.

fvPmgRm0qBs8gJHceqCduA.review_text: A much needed addition to the "other side" of Fillmore St. The restaurant is situated on the corner of Geary and Fillmore, across the street from the Fillmore Center. This side if the street is slowly picking up. There is State Bird (which I can never get into anymore) and Social Study close by (and in the event of a moment of utter weakness, Panda Express!!). The night I was here I had a flurry of small plates and grilled eel (damn that was good; see picture). For some reason I had some udon as well which was entirely too much food. But I liked it and enjoyed it at the time. The ride home was a little rocky since I felt like Shamu stuffed inside a sardine box. But I brought this upon myself and hence could not complain too loudly. And I will do it again. Anytime there is a show at the Fillmore, I will pre-party to my stomachs content with the beautiful people chowing down at this place.

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.review_text: I was not a fan of the food here; therefore I have no plans to return. The service and decor was great, however, but that's not my objective dining out! The food was either too greasy or lacking in flavor. Too bad, it's in my neighborhood!

-mIiXFN8U0bChS4WcRd8Ng.review_text: Sushi so fresh, delicious and beautiful -- and just across the street from the Kabuki Spa in Japantown. Aprés Spa? Absolutely!

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: 3.5 Stars  I came here with my family for dinner a few weeks ago. We ordered a great deal of food to sample ranging from tempuras to ramens. Since it's been too long I can only recall vaguely the food. While nothing truly stood out, it was all decent with no real flaws.   I will say that food does come out in a swift pace so try to order in waves versus all at once due to lack of table space. Also the music gravitates towards the EDM scene, right up my alley way, but might not be for everyone.  They have traditional Japanese sit down rooms good for large parties secluded from everyone else.  Service is quick, especially tables with call buttons.   Overall Thoughts  I will have to go back another time and relive the experience again

JOtF5CrxlvHKpoKU4ByAbQ.review_text: I've been here twice now. This place has a few things going for it:  1. It's accessible. Next to Japan town, so parking nearby is easy. And it kept popping up on opentable when I was looking for dinner options.  2. It's a nice scene.  3. The food isn't bad.  Apparently I'm doing lists today - so why not a higher score?  1. It's a scene, so the food is expensive for what it is.  2. Presentation is great here, taste is okay.  3. The meal seemed to be randomly coursed and orders have gotten mixed up every time I've come here.  4. What was unique here wasn't that good, it was the food that can found at any other Japenese restaurant that was done well.  5. Worst of all, the last time I was here they were out of uni.  This is a pretty good date destination. It could be fun to go drinking here with a group. But I'm leaving this review mostly so I don't accidentally make the mistake of initiating a third trip to this place without remembering what I'm getting myself into.

QDLTqEx-HXAX7zN2yC7U2g.review_text: Amazing food! I usually just do sushi when I go to a Japanese restaurant but Izakaya  Kou has a much more extensive menu. The best dish we had was the miso cod. Very flavorful and rich for a usually dull fish. We also enjoyed the roe don and volcano roll. The ginger cocktail was fantastic! The restaurant is very chic and there are a few rooms with recessed seating, traditional Japanese style. Great service, our waiter was very knowledgable about the more obscure dishes. A little pricey, but totally do able for a special occasion. I highly recommend this place.

x_PyGiblzQ2nFs3hoRHXYA.review_text: New restaurant, had to check it out. My server was Diane. Pretty, sweet and very knowledgeable of her menu. The food is on the pricy side but every dish is delicious. The set up of the place is pretty dope. Its Japanese style so you enter a room, take your shoes off and sit on the floor. Tried every sake and left pretty drunk. Good times

u_RB8njILJomIeEZ1QJXvQ.review_text: We were in the mood for Izakaya food later at night and were having bad luck with everyone being closed or unwilling to take us when they were about to close. Unlike the others, Izakaya Kou made us feel welcome even though kitchen was closing soon. The server was very friendly, helpful in recommendations, and gave us a primo table. The atmosphere here is much nicer and upscale than most Izakaya and the dishes were far more creative than typical. This was what I would conisider upsscale Izakaya. But the prices were not outrageous considering the atmosphere and quality of food.  Food standouts for me were (don't remember the proper names): 1) Battered japanese pumpkin with soft egg inside. This was a crazy Frankenstein creation that reminded me of a mixture between a corn dog and a scotch egg. It sounds weird, but was incredible tasting and a great portion size. 2) cheese corn - once again seems so simple as to be boring. It's cheese and corn. But it was delicious after an exhausting day of SF fun. It could have perhaps used a spicy component though for an extra dynamic. 3) chicken meatball - I'm not a big meat eater, but this was on point  If I lived closer to the area, I'd certainly want to go back post haste to try other stuff on the menu.   They also have an extensive sake selection if you're into that.  This was a real treat to have perfect food and service after other Izakaya places being unwelcoming jerks that night.

_RkyZClDvAdaG6xwgNaF5A.review_text: I came here for a friends birthday and we got the tatami room because are party was too large to be seated in the dining room. I have to say the service was really bad. Maybe because 18% gratuity was already added to the bill. We didn't get the menu nor a glass of water until I had to wave them down and that was 20 mins later. What was even worse is when the waitress asked us to clean are own table! (I think she is Korean) she told us to put the dishes that where done next to the sliding door. We told her that all the dishes where finish and that she can clear the table, but she insisted on us to put all the dishes which was more then 10+ next to the door. I think she didn't want to take off her shoes. My friend had to tell her that we didn't  want to get are hands dirty! She closed the door on us and never came back to clear the table even when we didn't have space to put the desert. You will expect excellent service if not at least good service after spending over $500 and giving $75 tip but think twice.  Besides the service food was ok and the atmosphere was nice.

0S_t5JmmTjtZsM46J9UHlQ.review_text: I couldn't be much happier to try my very first sashimi here at Izakaya!  We came here on a Saturday night, but since we didn't have reservations we waited about an hour to get seated.  The bar is quite small and they weren't enough chairs on the waiting area.  The place looked decent and it's somewhat "romantic".  I ordered Kou Sashimi (9 pcs) and it was satisfying!  Everything was fresh and well-prepared.  The uni onsen tamago was quite intriguing so I decided to give it a shot.  I'm not a big fan of uni, but this one was actually good.

yY77W4CAgbA45er1oIFpbw.review_text: We had the fortune to come here on their soft opening and beyond the delicious food and friendly service, I appreciated how serious they were in making sure their restaurant would be successful. Using it as a learning opportunity, they identified kinks to iron out and took feedback to enhance the menu.  A couple of weeks later, I came back with my brother and ordered some new and old dishes alongside a pitcher of Asahi. Once again the service was friendly and the food delicious. The sushi was great (especially the ankimo), especially for the price. The yakitori was well prepared. And the okonomiyaki awesome with the bacon. The only item that could have been done better was the miso black cod. It was much better at the soft opening as this time it was a bit rubbery. In any case, the taste was there.  I hope these guys rock it. The location hasn't had a great history of restaurants, and if there's one restaurant that has a chance among them, it's Izakaya Hashibiro Kou.
